ai.summary: Illey Way is a 13.8 km moderate hike in the United Kingdom that blends steady pacing with varied terrain, suitable for hikers with solid footing and mid-range endurance.
ai.terrain_summary: The route features a mix of firm gravel paths, woodland trails, occasional muddy sections, short rocky stretches, and grassy ascents. Expect variable weather and occasional puddles, with some exposed open sections and gentle climbs.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and daylight hours before you go. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and bring a waterproof layer. Carry a map or GPS, a basic first aid kit, and enough food and water. Tell someone your planned route and return time. Be prepared for mud, uneven ground, and sudden changes in weather common in the UK.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Small first aid kit and emergency whistle
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) are ideal due to longer daylight and drier trails; the hike is doable year-round with appropriate gear, but winter conditions may bring mud, ice, and reduced daylight.
